title: Utilities of Sequences

definitions.Sequence: A sequence is an ordered list of elements, often used in mathematics and computer science to represent a series of items or data points.

formulas: The nth term of an arithmetic sequence can be found using the formula: a_n = a_1 + (n - 1)d, where a_n is the nth term, a_1 is the first term, and d is the common difference.
summary: The slide discusses the concept of sequences, specifically focusing on the utility of sequences in mathematics and computer science. It defines a sequence and provides a formula for finding the nth term of an arithmetic sequence.
